info.name: Live Transcription in Talk
info.summary: Provides live transcriptions in Nextcloud Talk calls.
info.description:
Provides live transcriptions in Nextcloud Talk calls. High-performance backend (HPB) is required for this app to work.
The installation steps can be found here: https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/latest/admin_manual/ai/app_live_transcription.html#installation
IMPORTANT: Environment variables "LT_HPB_URL" and "LT_INTERNAL_SECRET" are required to be set in "Deploy Options" near the "Deploy and Enable" button before the install.
info.author: Anupam Kumar
Marcel Klehr

variable.name: LT_HPB_URL
variable.description: URL of the high-performance backend, same as the URL in the admin settings of Talk. It ends in "/spreed" usually and looks something like "wss://cloud.example.com/standalone-signaling/spreed".

variable.name: LT_INTERNAL_SECRET
variable.display-name: Internal secret of the high-performance backend
variable.description: Internal secret used to authenticate with the high-performance backend. This is not the same as the shared secret in the admin settings of Talk.

variable.name: LT_VOSK_SERVER_URL
variable.description: Leave it empty to use the built-in transcriber. Audio is sent to this server for transcription. It should be of the form "ws://localhost:2702". The internal Vosk server will listen on this interface and port if enabled.

variable.name: LT_DISABLE_INTERNAL_VOSK
variable.description: "LT_VOSK_SERVER_URL" should point to a functioning Vosk server in this case. Accepted values are "1", "0", "true", "false".

variable.name: SKIP_CERT_VERIFY
variable.description: When set to "true" or "1", certificate verifications will ke skipped for the websocket connections to the HPB.

variable.name: LT_MAX_WORKERS
variable.description: This limits concurrency of the transcription and by extension the max GPU/system memory usage. One worker processes one stream at a time. The default is calculated based on the CPU thread count of the server.
